preqs: MEC2401, ENG2091 or MTH2021 or MTH2032 or ENG2005

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG2091, MEC2401} or  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ENG2005, MEC2401} or  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {MEC2401, MTH2021} or  Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {MEC2401, MTH2032})

description: The fundamental concepts of rigid body and particle dynamics taught in the second level dynamics unit will be further reinforced.  This unit then focusses on mechanical vibrations theory.  The methodology for analysing the response of a vibratory system to given external stimuli is covered.  Both single and multi-degrees of freedom and discrete and continuous vibratory systems will be analysed.  The methods for developing the equations of motion of a vibratory system using Newton's 2nd law and the Lagrange equation and the manipulation of these equations to analyse the free and forced vibration responses of these systems will be introduced.  The analysis of forced vibrations will include periodic and non-periodic forcing functions.
